segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't even notice the water overflowing and forming a puddle around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost like she's in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what she's thinking about.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are up to no good, but she has no clue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit sad for her, missing out on the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just going to keep flowing until someone notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she realizes soon before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit fearful for what might happen next.
segments.speaker: PAR
